docs.lead_paragraph: CONTRARY to popular beliefs, people who exercise regularly do not sleep less, eat less or smoke less than people who are inactive, a national survey shows. Nor are highly active people more likely to have lost weight in recent years than those who do some, but relatively little, exercise.
